uBbUBmV7eEpw5xondEKkVA.text: Terrible!!! Against my better judgement, we tried out mr. Tokyo based on the glowing reviews. I normally stay away from buffets and all you can eat deals because the food is usually mediocre or terrible, but somehow we found ourselves here hoping for some good food...not looking for a deal. First warning sign was that it is not Japanese run or operated. Yes, they're East Asian, but not Japanese...not the same! I guess it's better than the sushi place uptown that was run and operated by Indians!?! Needless to say, it went out of business.   They didn't have sparkling water so we settled for club soda (they charged us for club soda, now that's a first). We ordered lemonade for my 4yo and asked for an extra cup to split the drink with our 19 month old. They wouldn't allow it - she can't drink a whole cup and we never intended for a refill. Fine, order another lemonade. Neither of my girls drank more than a quarter of their drinks. Then as we ordered, asked about sashimi pieces and the waitress repeated several times how there's a .50 surcharge for sashimi. OK, it's written there plain as day and we still want it. Then I asked the difference between a classic vs. hand roll, stating I want the kind with rice on the outside. Response: if you don't want rice, it's an extra dollar. Ummm I want rice but thanks for reminding how you nickel and dime your customers anyway you can. Also, if you're removing an ingredient and it's all made on request, why would you charge extra?? So strange.  Re: food, we started with miso soups that tasted like tap water and almost raw seaweed. I ordered fried rice for the kids, shrimp tempura, gyoza dumplings, spring rolls and cali roll. I've never seen a shrimp tempura look like that...it was also mainly batter and very little shrimp. Spring rolls were bland and Costco has better dumplings. My mother and husband eat sashimi and sushi often so they ordered the volcano roll, a few pieces of salmon and yellowtail. They were extremely disappointed by the lack of freshness with the sashimi. The volcano roll was DRENCHED in mayo and sauce - my husband felt like he drank a bottle of mayo. After our initial plates, we were still hungry but didn't want to subject ourselves to more terrible food. We regretted not going to musashi (Japanese family run) or Baku. I would GLADLY pay double or triple the amount to eat quality Japanese food and also not be reminded constantly about how much you are paying for the food. It was such a bizarre and kind of annoying experience. My husband apologized profusely for even suggesting it.   If you like sashimi, head over to clean catch fish market and request their sashimi grade faro island salmon or tuna. Pair it with some soy sauce, wasabi and ginger, and you'll have a delicious sashimi experience in Charlotte, in your home! If that's too much work, try musashi or Baku - much more expensive, but you get what you're paying for.

1VFq-_IWMuSL5lhnO5ZcKg.text: This was easily the best sushi we have had in Charlotte. After trying several places and being disappointed every time, Mr. Tokyo was a very pleasant surprise, especially for all you can eat. I was expecting the quality to be low, but that was not at all the case. Each roll was fresh, vibrant, and well constructed. The fish was incredibly fresh. I love yellowtail and the yellowtail sushi appetizer was the best I've had... ever. The service was very friendly and professional. My single complaint was that it was very, very slow. We waited for a table for 30 minutes, began eating at 7pm, and didn't finish until 9pm!! That was an exceptionally long time for people who can usually eat a meal in 15 minutes . Seriously though, super super slow but I thought it was fabulous quality sushi and friendly staff. Plus, $17.99 for all you can eat sushi included hibachi, some entrees, appetizers, soups, and sides. It was an incredible selection. I will be going back for sure.

cb_qBxIA7GtfcP_xf4MiUQ.text: The food was very good and our server frequently checked in on us.  Some reviews said they used too much rice, but It didn't seem like it to us.  We were really happy with everything we had- salads, rolls, nigiri and hand roll. Will definitely go back.

KkNknZ51oSdgMyuc8V28TA.text: We loved the hidden treasure and will def be back! All you can eat is a super deal! Delicious and service was great too!!

QdOTV_oypi_vQgIPIru59Q.text: Terrible service. Walked into the restaurant only to stand at the door and not receive any service for 5 minutes. No one even acknowledged our presence until we decided to seat ourselves. Only then did one of the restaurant associates tells us to wait but then proceeds to continue what he was doing prior. Very rude and unacceptable. Will never come to establishment again.

6s8DhkIkAUvQUAdSoGWmKg.text: Nice restaurant and very nice ambiance ! Excellent food ! very reasonable price.  I have been here for lunch couple of times with my family, they loved it.  I am going to be a frequent visitor for this restaurant.

pBD7Hb8rUGMMFT2urB5Bsw.text: Fresh and delicious sushi. The grilled squid was on point. However, they stir fry the udon noodles which kinda dry up the noodles and make the noodles not that chewy anymore. I will definitely come back for some more.

XqK8WHgQTMxrz8McadtscA.text: This place was very good. Can't believe they've been open since April and I haven't heard about until stumbling across the top-rated reviews here on Yelp. Everything from the service, the food quality, selection (abundance) to the ambience was top notch. $11.99 AYCE lunch... $17.99 AYCE for dinner. Will definitely be back!

CWKteehEYeqUUyfka6gEpQ.text: If you are a sushi fan then this place is the place for you. Pretty much all the reviews sum up about this place. I took my parents there during lunch and we were very impressed especially you can order the specialty rolls from the menu. Usually the all you can eat sushi place there is a limit on what you can order from the menu. We went during lunch and the staff was very attentive. We ordered the Miami roll and it was so good. Its ice cream was also very good. I hope they keep up with its quality and continues to do well.

nvC1FOOicEwWfaaKMrZ16A.text: Went here for lunch Saturday.  The Saturday/Sunday is $16.99 for all you can eat.  The Monday-Friday lunch is $11.99.  Basically for that price you can order anything on the menu, but you have to eat it all.  I got 4 specialty rolls and then a few pieces of nigiri and squid salad later on.  I think I got my moneys worth.  I would have easily paid $9.00 per specialty roll plus the other items.  I got out of there, for 2 people, $40 plus tip.  That was for a total of 6 specialty rolls, 6 pieces of nigiri, squid salad, 2 drinks, tax.  Anywhere else in town that $70 all day long.  The sushi was as good as anywhere else in town.  I was a bit turned off by the "lettuce" in the softshell crab roll, but whatever.  The staff is super friendly and helpful.  I will definitely be coming back here, especially during lunch when its even cheaper.  This is a great alternative to Ru-Sans but the seating is somewhat limited.

8ZNYwFYf7dV0L23ya0oHGA.text: Very good service, Kelsey was very personable.  Panther and Snow White rolls were excellent.  We liked the all you can eat without being buffet.

eTJnReUqxxBrjaLREOcnzA.text: Really enjoy this place... it's the best sushi in town, and a hidden gem right now. All you can eat!

Z0X0jNvlWuB5kvRFOly1dA.text: I did the all you can eat here. They have a good variety of choices on the menu, the majority being sushi. The food was good quality. The server I had seemed like she did not want us there but it did not hinder my eating experience. One thing to note is that they charge for left over food so it's best to order a little bit at a time. I will come back when I have a bigger appetite!

TP5GgJ_Pb1Zs_I8pi6lNww.text: Great for lunch & dinner! Weekday lunch is $12.99 per person. Dinner hours start at 15:00 (3pm) weekend is $18.99 per adult. Sometimes they get your order wrong and give you one roll too much which will effect your check if you don't eat it all. Each piece of sushi left over is a $1 surcharge.  Bring friends and enjoy the all you can order experience!

cuLm2RlqqLa0xEEF8bnaAg.text: AMAZING . Best service and waitress I have ever had!! I am  definitely going again!! Thank you for being my new favorite place to eat. Perfect for a date night

9y-ujdw18j91zaIRLQuvfQ.text: Great food! Awesome service. When my husband mentioned unlimited sushi I was totally down and excited for it. It didn't disappoint!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Tokyo Japanese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

8xiIkLY26AVrkFeGd0kDzA.text: I have now been here three times and each time the serves has varied, but I am sure it is hard to be a server at a place like this since people probably stay longer than they want.  BUT what do you expect at a place that is all you can eat? This last time they added a gratuity to our party of 5 so watch out for that on your bill.  The sushi is solid, but basic very similar to what you find in the local grocery stores. The sashimi is NOT worth the .50 per piece up charge so my suggestion is stay away from that. Also when you are ordering on their sheets make sure you check the correct column S for sashimi and N nigiri.  The place is small and if you can go when they are not busy that would be my suggestion. It is worth the $18.99 especially if you are going for sushi.  Enjoy and go hungry!

EGtzWezxbPnVmgwFJTh8Jg.text: Excellent AYCE sushi restaurant! When I got there, I was told there would be a 40 minute wait until the next table. I was by myself, and I didn't want to sit at the bar so I was definitely prepared to wait the whole time. I came back into the restaurant 40 minutes later and I was actually surprised at how many people were in there! It must be a popular spot.  The waitress sat me down and let me choose from a menu of sushi and other items, which I gladly accepted. I got all of the spicy options and they were extremely delicious! The sushi was well prepared, and I like the fact that they gave me a huge plate with all the sushi instead of several smaller plates like Sushi King does. No problems with my food, it came relatively quickly, and I left feeling full and satisfied! I brought some spicy mayo sauce to dip the sushi in because I knew they didn't have any there ;-)  That trip ended my search for the best sushi restaurant in Charlotte, I felt like it couldn't get better than that. Each shallow breath of mine was rewarding because I knew, due to me eating too much, that the food was good and had attacked my brain with an overload of flavor and deliciousness. Thank you guys!!

dKCbAoTCqLXOJJhwd5uZbg.text: We heard this was a great sushi bar and it is! Fresh sushi, tender rice and flavorful! It is our favorite sushi restaurant.  I would highly recommend going to Mr. Tokyo restaurant!

rcve9v22DayFcaYXEr6GjA.text: 3.5 Stars!  Mr Tokyo is a Japanese restaurant located in Charlotte, NC.  I was there for a business trip, and my boss / manager picked this place to eat for dinner after we got off the plane.  They are known for their AYCE (All You Can Eat) / unlimited Sushi & Hibachi ($18.99 per person for adults).  Be careful as they do charge for leftovers!!    I rated it 3.5 stars because it's not exactly authentic, but for the $18.99 AYCE price, it's really worth the value and the quality of the fish.  I came with my boss and another colleague - all of us agreed that their salmon was really fresh (at the time).  Good variety and selection for the price.    ENJOY!!

LnFNmjlwscH3esmORi7DUA.text: I couldn't wait to visit Mr. Tokyo! Talk about Pure Excellence! Everything is fresh, made to order. The Best Sushi In Charlotte!!! If sushi isn't your thing, there are other options available. Why go anywhere else, when you can have AYCE sushi and hibachi for $18.99 (dinner price)! The only downside is not taking home the leftovers. Otherwise, you'd be insane to pass up this deal! Each roll is packed with high-quality ingredients. I've eaten here twice for dinner within the past two weeks--with no wait time during each visit. Not. sure what the lunch crowd is like.   I'm highly impressed with the size and quality of the Chef Special Rolls! You should definitely come hungry, and wear your stretch pants. My first visit, I walked out waddling!  I prefer the specialty rolls because I'm obsessed with the plating!!! Definitely, picture worthy!   Here are my personal favorites! I would highly recommend ordering these:  I've ordered the Mr. Tokyo & Snow White Roll twice already. So what does that tell you? Hahaha!   Dragon & White Dragon Roll  Lobster Salad Roll - This will open your sinus's for sure. I've never had a lobster salad but this was pretty amazing.   I'll be coming back for my third visit this week. I plan to enjoy hibachi this time.

OfQ8qxbHCut4Qite4ZvBhg.text: Have been to this location more times that I can count. Definitely come hungry!! The sushi is consistently good and comes out pretty quickly. They tend to add new rolls often to keep the menu interesting which I enjoy.   There is usually a pretty long wait, especially on Friday nights, unless you go during off hours.

_52CRFfP7Sfn3lHkZrZZqw.text: This was, wait, this is, THE BEST SUSHI restaurant my husband and I have ever been too! Hands down I give them 5 stars. They are super busy so arrive early and expect to wait. The wait was very very much worth it. We don't live locally and We will come back if we are ever near the area. Amazing job!

ZRrBKtVxn3soSBW1fgwnkA.text: I was missing Fujami something awful and saw this new place. Beautifully redesigned inside.  Then they brought the menu and told me they had UNLIMITED sushi for lunch for 12.99. . Yes, 12.99.  So I had seaweed salad and 3 rolls.  This Snow White roll was phenomenal!!! This isnt crappy buffet sushi- it's high end sushi with real Japanese sushi masters. I can't wait to tell my husband so we can come back and eat so much sushi we pop.... h0GG-lfM3K9vt8T75IE80A.text: This review is meant for the Benfield Rd. location. I tried to find the location on here, but couldn't.   Anyway, my review goes as such.   Jesus... this is my favorite sushi/hibachi spot in Charlotte. I could legit eat here every day of my life. UNLIMITED sushi AND hibachi. No buffet. All hot, fresh, and delicious.   I was first introduced to this place by someone I was dating who completely wasted my time, but in the words of Fantasia Barrino, "sometimes you gotta lose to win again" and every time I eat here, I feel like I'm winning and winning and winning. The food has been varying levels of exceptional each and every time. ONLY ONCE was my hibachi slightly less than warm, but out of the 20+ times I have eaten here in the second half of 2018 ALONE, that is the first and only time it has happened. Another time, there was one waiter who was absolutely terrible, but I haven't seen him since that day. If you go, ask for Paige or Nancy. Paige is super cool, funny, and a great waitress and Nancy makes sure you're taken care of. Keep it up ladies!  Favorite things to order: Nigiri - Masago, Surf Red Clam, and Shrimp Hibachi - Shrimp/Chicken + extra shrimp sauce Sushi - Anything not deep fried Dessert - Fried Ice Cream  I legit eat here once a week and I always leave with a little pep in my step, a little wiggle in my jiggle, and a dip in my hip! Easily my favorite restaurant of 2018.

hK4qr842NF7kxs8glrNqAA.text: I stopped in around 2:30 pm for a super-late lunch today...and was surprised to see that the place was nearly packed!  I soon realized why.  With their "Unlimited", All-You-Can-Eat Lunch Special, you can order anything on the menu (minus desserts and drinks?), and have as many plates/bowls as you want for just $12.99!  How can you beat that?? I have to say that their Miso Soup didn't taste quite right, but loved their fresh Crabmeat Salad...and their Maki Rolls (I ordered Dynamite and TNT) were the Bomb! I also had to try their Green Tea Mochi Ball for dessert (for a very small charge...less than $2?).  This small, lone Mochi Ice Cream Ball is topped with Whipped Cream...and was pretty good (nothing too special, but good).  Actually perfectly sized treat to come after an "unlimited" feast!  The place itself is quite small, but very cozy with a generous number of dark wooden chairs and booths.  As typical with most Asian restaurants, the service was quick and accommodating, though fairly stiff (due to possible language barrier?).  Overall, I found Mr. Tokyo VERY attractive (SO generous!)...and I definitely plan on revisiting "him" in the future.

TEGMVvbEfWE9i_0RGcEpbw.text: I was so excited to try this sushi place, but it led to nothing but disappointment. I was enticed by the stellar reviews & the "all you can eat" menu. It was probably some of the worst sushi I've ever had. We ordered side salads, fried rice, & 6 rolls. Only 2 of our rolls tasted good. With our last couple of rolls we couldn't finish them because they tasted so bad (and normally we can eat sushi for dayyyyyyys). It's clean, is decorated nice, & the staff is nice, but that's about it. I don't know if we came on a bad night, but I'm not willing to come back to find out.

Just a mere hour and 40 minutes to get the food. -t9LdWRCdDZb6bQngY5F2Q.text: For those that have actually had great sushi before, this restaurant will disappoint.   Fake crab on everything, room temp pieces of raw fish.  Everything smothered in so much "special sauce" that you can't taste what little fish is in the roll.  It's commercial and probably a good place for people that have not had Truely great sushi.  Update:  Immigration Krab should be reserved for the worst grocery store packaged sushi.  It has no business being in a restaurant. People need to understand that "the best sushi restaurant in Charlotte" falls short here.  Raising your prices and serving quality food would be helpful.

MH5vzxlh9QySqMTF8Sl_1w.text: I love Mr. Tokyo! When craving sushi it is a great price for the quantitiy! The quality is also outstanding. I would like the to bring my the Miami Roll for lunch however!

HPV5bWWGFRedjbodRMgRVQ.text: Just love the concept. Sushi is decent.  Food comes out hot. Hibachi can be too salty at times, but over all I still give 5 stars

ioL4Bfor34xmjYvsUK9cvg.text: Saw all the raving review here and checking out what it is all about.  The atmosphere is nice and clean.  The pop music is on the loud side.  their plating looks good and things goes down hill. 4*  Well, the sushi are made to order by 2 chiefs, this means a long wait time from order to food on the table.  Other places i have been had 4 chefs churning food out.  The food are blend.  I am not a soy sauce sushi guy and this place coverted me. 3*  The sea foods are sliced thin just liked fish baits.  Where is the taste of the fish? The rice portion is huge.  Speaking of the rice, it is not very well cooked.  You can sense each grain and the entire ball is hard to chew as I had to fight with them. 3*  Nice thing is their rice are warm. The seaweeds are crisp. 5*  I guess this is Charlotte.

JjXmTNFl792xI9uXo8-lQg.text: $16.99 gets you all you can eat on the dinner menu, with a few caveats.  Let's put this into perspective: nowadays, what can you REALLY get for $16.99?  You can't get 2 rolls at a regular sushi joint; you can't get 2 small plates at a tapas restaurant; you can get 1 pizza but not an appetizer -- let's be real; $16.99 doesn't get you much, rarely the opportunity to gorge yourself to the brink of calling a state of digestive emergency.  Mr. Tokyo gets 4.5 stars -- rounding up to 5 for: (1) good service; (2) good food; and (3) superb value.    THE CAVEATS: 1)  If you want sashimi, there's a $.50/piece upcharge -- reasonable since you're getting twice the sushi with half the ability to fill up because you're not consuming any carbs or fillers 2)  No waste policy.  If you have 4+ pieces leftover (that's half a roll), then you will be charged for the roll but you can take it home with you  Location and ambience. It's located in a strip mall and the restaurant is relatively small, which explains the wait time.  The decor tries to be modern with backlighting but otherwise nothing remarkable and is your typical Japanese or sushi restaurant.    Good service. We came around 3 pm on a Saturday afternoon and were seated right away (the restaurant was 25% full).  Our server was extremely attentive and prompt, gave us the rundown on the restaurant rules, and seamlessly served or cleared away everything we needed and didn't need, respectively.   Good food.  All things considered, the food here is solid, especially given that you're meant to eat in bulk -- the Costco of sushi dining, so to speak.  You're not going to get Toro or any other premium grade sushi because that's not what you're paying for; if that's what you're seeking, be prepared to shell out 3 or 4 times more for your meal (if this is your expectation, then I'm calling you out for being one of those whiners who expects champagne on a beer budget).  There are quite a few AYCE sushi joints in S Cal with this exact premise; Mr. Tokyo is right on par with the 4.5-star S Cal counterparts.    TIP: you can ask for substitutions or modifications to your order so you get exactly what you want.  For example, I only wanted the sweet potato in the vegetable tempura and that's exactly what they brought me.  I've had: +++  miso soup.  The broth is a perfect blend of the miso stuff and tofu; I've been to places where it's super watered down before +++  squid salad.  The squid salad is superb (ask for lemon to squeeze over it for a little tangy kick; this is how it's usually served at other sushi restaurants) and usually is $9 just for the salad +++  yellowtail.  We've had yellowtail all over Charlotte: BLT Steakhouse, Baku, Cowfish, and Hibiscus and the yellowtail here is better than Cowfish and Hibiscus (you're limited to one order per customer) +++  shrimp tempura.  Crispy and the ponzu sauce is great (sweet with just a little tangy lemon kick); my BF liked it with the spicy mayo.  +++  sweet potato tempura.  A teeny bit on the greasy side but it's tempura, after all.  Clearly wasn't way too greasy because I asked for two orders. +++  ika (squid) sushi.  The freshness, consistency and sweetness of the squid is great; I had 4 orders (you order them 1 piece at a time).  I added masago to my second order. +++  philly roll.  I like the cream cheese and usually order this sans avocado.  Next time, I'll stick with the Panther roll because it tastes better and has the cream cheese in it +++ Panther roll.  Delicious.  It has shrimp tempura, cream cheese, crab, jalapeno and sriracha.  It was splendid.    Room for improvement.  They will only make you a full roll so you really have to commit to 7-10 pieces; I'd prefer to have the flexibility to try more items and order half rolls but I get it, it's more work for them.  Value.  First and foremost, for eating at an establishment that serves bulk raw fish, it passes the digestive test (after your meal, are you counting the minutes until you get home and taking an inventory of the number of people in your car vs the number of bathrooms you have?; would this be a safe first date venue? -- the epitome of diner's remorse).  Second, the overall dining experience was commensurate to the price; in fact, given there are few places where you can stuff your face and still get pretty good quality food, it feels like a steal (the table adjacent to us served two people 4 sushi rolls each; they were in it to win it!).  When it comes to consuming raw fish, especially considering that you know that you're not being served premium grade sushi, you have to be cognizant that you're taking a calculated digestive risk; there's a delicate balance between quality vs. quantity.  However, the risk here is small, the food is solid, and the value is tremendous.  Kudos to Mr. Tokyo for finding that equilibrium and delivering on a great dining experience that is worth every penny.

XNJtp-767Jt-g9tdxMOmhw.text: Definitely a fan but didn't do it right and go to dine-in for the (wait for it!) All. You. Can. Eat. Special!!!!  The AYCE is definitely part of the experience hence (yes, I can use that word in a sentence since this is a review. Hence, the use of hence!) the crowds forming in and out of the lobby, the doorway, and spilling out on to the sidewalk.  The sushi is fresh and delicious, the only two things people ask of sushi.

4f4JOU3FDVoDVXljDQknng.text: This is an "all you can eat" sushi/hibachi place. However, if you waste any food you'll get charged some $ for not finishing them. I think it's .50 per piece. We live about an hour away but this has become our go to spot for sushi. It is the BEST and freshest sushi that we've ever had and so we do make the drive whenever we're in the mood for sushi. We've had the clear soup, cream cheese Rangoon, spring rolls,  pork dumplings, and tempura shrimp and tempura vegetables off the appetizer menu before and we loved it! For sushi, you'll have to mark on the piece of paper what you want and they'll make it fresh for you. Keep in mind, it's not like going to the Chinese buffet and picking it off the bar. We haven't had anything here that we didn't like. I would recommend this place to anyone who loves sushi and can eat a lot!!! Price for adult during lunch is 12.99 and for dinner it's 18.99. Yes, it may seem pricey but for the quality and quantity of the food here you will not be disappointed. It's always so busy that sometimes we have to get on the waitlist to be seated but it's worth it!

Photo of Mr Tokyo Japanese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

LEUP0-f1SJrDDrt0nHA8nA.text: I have been here many times. The all you can eat is wonderful! The food is so good. The Miami Roll is my absolute favorite. Unfortunately, they need a better waiting system. They write down names and just mark off random ones as they go. They say it's a 30 minute wait, but 30 turned into an hour. There's not much space there to wait either.

D2s5nTZjVxaa8W2xCGGFjg.text: Went here for lunch. The price is very affordable for lunch $11.99. I got the all you can eat option.   The rice to fish ratio was very off balance. So they have to make money some how.

F2YVnoW5WS3MHq_9eR_cqA.text: My kids loved it overall. Perfect amount of food and great price.  On the adult side. It was just ok. Not bad but didn't blow me away.   Service was not very good. Waitress seemed a little clueless. And a bit slow.  Good option for a bite but not my preferred spot. Will give it another shot

t6wnotkg1vM2ONRkQKwVTg.text: Awesome high quality all you can eat sushi menu that also has a lot of non sushi kitchen menu items included!    The only down side is that it takes a long time to get your food when re-ordering additional items.   We learned that it is better to order as much as you will eat on the 1st round so that you will not feel full just by waiting for your additional rounds of food to come.  We will be back!

8TOCDeQZB5JGiE8luiYuPA.text: Ok.... I went back. I didn't try the older rolls that I tried on my previous visit, but I tried some new ones I live the tempura they used on their rolls. It's not super thick and gives the perfect texture to the rolls. The Las Vegas roll is delish.   RU Sans offers an all u can eat lunch, but their rolls are small and tiny. The rolls at Mr. Tokyo are huge!!! Worth the money, the ambiance is awesome, the service is great.  And the sashimi...OMG! The THICKEST and freshest sashimi ever. The sashimi dies cost .50 cents each... but you will not regret it. Blown me away. Service is excellent, as before. Try the Coconut sake, it's a cold sake, but it's good. It's the first time I've ever had cold sake. And such a pretty bottle!   Bravo! One of my fave places to eat at. And the only place I would eat sushi at.

RhIfdfqSmvKfZ06uECvG_A.text: Absolutely loved this place. We went on a Friday and had to wait for seating for about 20 minutes. It was worth it. I love that they do all you can eat to order. The "mr Tokyo bowl" was my absolute favorite! We also had quite a few rolls, my favorite being the summer roll, which I think was seasonal. We'll definitely be back!

D0MLtRCjQmq62ilWviqrLA.text: Love this place. You can do all you can eat where you order sushi and other Japanese favorites of the menu. Not a buffet so food is fresh and always great.  You can also just order a meal off the menu.  Great place to eat.

wm0xzM7T6bsLPz705k-wfQ.text: There aren't any places that even come close to this quality for this price. Specialty rolls are all amazing made to order with fresh ingredients. 23zpBKuUdDc5UUBOEAbBDQ.text: We were looking for a combo sushi/hibachi restaurant for a birthday party group of 8. This came highly recommended. The service was very friendly, but pretty scattered. We had to ask for chopsticks, then wasabi, etc. But it was pleasantly handled and we were all in good spirits. The sushi was okay. The selection of rolls was disappointing in that, even tho there were more than I've seen at other unlimited restaurants, it seemed most were deep fried or tempura style. "Spicy" really wasn't. The Unagi was barely there. We all had a good time, but for the price of the unlimited, and the high recommendation, food-wise it was just okay.

AIG9pALQowXaa5U2tw7_Ug.text: Make sure you come here ready to eat! Talk about all you can eat! They don't play here! They have a great selection of starters, hibachi, and multiple sushi rolls to select from! One of my favorite rolls has to be the Carolina Roll, or the mango roll! So good! And best of it all you don't get to break the wallet when going to Mr. Tokyo since it's very affordable sushi eating experience.

sciRJUcykF2Je0c0k4nJWw.text: This place is the best restaurant in Charlotte. They have all-you-can-eat high quality sushi and other Japanese dishes for lunch. The price is definitely reasonable, and the service is quick and friendly. I come here regularly, it's the best deal in the city.

g55vRewksGYRjieTqwg2AA.text: I come here all the time for my sushi fix... But oh boy... The sanitation rating... You really gotta consider the level of cleanliness is going into your body. The sanitation rating is 87.5. That's not even an A. They're serving sushi, some raw and it's not even at an A grade cleanliness restaurant. I mean the service and variety is nice at this place but just fair warning.

zz3YPEupeh2RSiUKH5YgGQ.text: Great sushi, great price. Not a lot of sushi buffet can match the quality here. Friendly staff. Though accommodations can be lacking at times

_Wnna3RwOHJW56mxU7pKSA.text: Not sure why the raving reviews. The sushi is mediocre to say the best, and they charge nigiri $1 per piece!!! Over rated and over priced. Not too bad for lunch, definitely not coming here for dinner.

guCe8m2_4LN7d1KvrIfcXg.text: Really like the selection in the all you can eat sushi. Nice staff and good service. And the sushi is very good. Lunch is a better deal, but dinner isn't too pricey.

tNFDqQpI_-fvclDuq7KPOg.text: The quality of the food is good and tasty! Great variety of choices. My wife and and had hibachi with beef and shrimp and it was cooked well. We could easily chew it. It was great! We also had three different type of sushi rolls and my favorite was the Mr. Tokio one, which was full of flavor.   I want to go back to try other specialty sushis. What I don't think I've ever seen before is that they will charge you for every piece of roll you don't eat, so it's better to start with something small and after you finish you can order more. This is the only reason I give it four stars.  We'll come back again for sure.

7HFbhr7I915ddVulKUOhRQ.text: Most amazing place I had ever eaten! Very high quality sushi. Me and my husband have 4 kids and pay a baby sitter and drive an hour one way to eat here at least 1x a week!

XiNeQakFd9sIFAcgTbpauA.text: If the Carolinas lack anything, it's good Asian food. There is literally zero good Chinese food. Mr. Tokyo almost makes up for it with their Japanese offering. This has become our favorite place to eat in the Charlotte area. The value is incredible - $14 for lunch and $19(?) for dinner.   The nigiri quality is what you'd expect. You definitely get what you pay for. I wish they had the white tuna (escolar) at lunch.   They change their roll offerings almost too much that I don't remember which ones I liked and if they were removed. I will say the rolls are really the best value here. Having moved from out of state, some of their rolls easily can go toe-to-toe with rolls we've seen go for $14 at regular price (which we got at half-price #ladies night).   What I love is they also have hibachi and [at dinner] noodle dishes - great for people who don't like sushi (they have a bunch of other non-sushi items).   Their cheese rangoons (now crab?)...I think they're imported from heaven and are delivered on a golden cloud of hope and joy.   The service is great. Never had a problem. The hosts will often pitch in to help deliver the food. And they are surprisingly very accommodating - I was near full and wanted fried rice and they said they'd do a small plate vs regular size for me. Awesome people.   So overall, heck yes. The quality is better than you'd expect and the rolls are better than we deserve.

meXZB41mpAE1IxI8qRxGLQ.text: Sushi fanatic here!!!! I absolutely love sushi. Doesn't matter what it is. NOM NOM!!! Have been here twice already. Once for din din and then another for lunch. This place is amazing. Everything comes out super fresh. It's made on the spot when you order it. The best part.....you can eat as much as you want. Great selection of items. I was quite surprised.   Great for a big group or just by yourself. Had a great time and left super full.

9RGCFxNBsnixeKNjWCFxzQ.text: The bad: The nickel-and-diming has to stop! From the moment you walk in they immediately start telling you about how they upcharge for every little thing. Want Sashimi? $.50 per piece! Don't like something or can't finish it? $1.00 per roll! Their massive rolls average 8 big pieces per roll, which makes it very hard to do any real sampling unless you're just absolutely pigging out or with a large group.  The good: The rolls are pretty creative and quite tasty. The sushi is the quality that you'd expect at this type of restaurant: not great but pretty good. It's nice that they have some appetizers and cooked items as part of the AYCE menu.  Overall not sure if I'll go back or not. A good coupon would probably be enough to sway me.

mtPksW_5LWWHsBhHeVAkRw.text: Man, sometimes I wish I wasn't pregnant so I can order anything on this all you can eat menu! I've ordered most of the cooked sushi that were listed and it was so good. Everything tasted fresh so I'm sure if I were to order raw fish they would be also.  Nice selections of appetizers so be careful when ordering bec they really fill you up fast.   Definitely my go to (ayce) sushi place!

5K0l-N9RJKqQ6hMqWoDj1g.text: You can't go wrong will all you can eat. Every item we have was fresh and top notch. I would rate this establishment as the best in the area and they are super fast

RuMktqfOPi_SjY-QgG_AOA.text: atmosphere 3 price 2 food 2/3 service 4 overall for the money and experience probably 2.5/5  I didn't know it was a chain restaurant. This is for the Charlotte location. Not sure if other locations have the same menu.   Photo from previous posts for all-you-can-eat dinner menu have the correct information when I went to visit.   Food quality was so-so/average compared to cheaper to mid-ranged pricing. What was disappointing was extra charge for sashimi, which I suppose is more common than not in this region.   More than that, the special rolls are full rolls which can pretty much fill you up with one or two rolls. the hibachi/teriyaki dishes are full sized dishes as well. If you're only going for dinner with a friend, it's not worth it.  their version of squid was a full sized plate as well, not very well seasoned, and rubbery. Shrimp tempura was also heavily battered and probably fried in old oil, again, texture also consistent with sushi restaurants this region.  Over all, I was more disappointed with portion sizes of their rolls and grill dishes on the AYCE menu as I wasn't able to try a lot of their food.

Ag4XenokJIgLZ2TSSONW5Q.text: This place is delicious, you will walk out full to the rim. Freshly made and served ... all you can eat and it's well worth it. The staff are very pleasant and ready to serve you!!

FRWIFNoncIQWvxGRS08orQ.text: (4/28/18) My wife noticed something important about the kitchen entree selections at the top of the all you can eat menu.For the entrees under Teriyaki, Hibachi, or Tempura you are given the choice of steak, shrimp or chicken. You are also given the choice of not having vegetables or rice. If you choose shrimp tempura, without veggies and rice, you are given three fairly large shrimp. But if you order the hibachi shrimp you get a small serving of popcorn shrimp. She made the discovery trying to eat all of the entree without having to pay the uneaten charge.  The proteins by themselves are cooked well and are accompanied by a good tasting dipping sauce. I try to eat something that I haven't had before every time I eat there. This time I tried the mackerel nigiri. Wow! Talk about a fishy tasting fish! The taste and smell brought back memories of growing up in a New England seaport. It really livened up my palate as well. My wife's only comment was that only I and the dog enjoy mackerel.  The hostesses seemed glad to see me again. They kept asking me where I'd been and that I had to come by more often.

ka3zspZGJvUNNzEsdxH-IA.text: My sister and I were craving some sushi and found Mr Tokyo on yelp.    I love the all you can eat deal at lunch for $12.99.  I ordered a couple of sushi rolls and some edamame.  Everything was really tasty and the food came out promptly.  I missed the fine print on the menu that said you will be charged if you do not eat a certain amount sushi.  Just make sure you do not order more than you will eat.

qrB36kmDMYRlMhYEm6_1Sg.text: I've been here a couple of times, and it hits the spot each time. More like taking the spot and throwing it down the road since I probably overeat. They provide decent variety (not great but not bad), but they definitely give a good helping for each specialty roll, so you can't really try a lot of different ones in a single sitting. The best way is to share with a larger group to get a few bites of each.  The service is fine and there's always a little bit of a wait during peak dinner time. Don't expect fine dining here though.

PgrIq4B0qLUxuHvJcSb4bA.text: This is a great unlimited sushi and hibachi place in McMullen Creek shopping Center in Pineville. It is not a buffet! They provide table service and the sushi is freshly prepared to order! Lunch for an adult is $12.99 and dinner is $18.99. They don't serve the lunch menu on Saturday and Sunday. All of the food that I have had from them has been very good except the miso soup which tastes like chlorine. They seriously need to use filtered water or something. I'm still giving it five stars because everything else I've had from them has been great and the value is there as well. They offer standard sushi (nigiri, sashimi, maki) and specialty rolls. All of the specialty rolls that I have tried have been top notch! The hibachi is really tasty too so don't overlook that. One warning, don't over order as you may be charged if you are not able to eat it all. All in all this is a great place and a welcome addition to the Pineville area!

HUdTgIyM-rixJJLE4XMwhg.text: I think the place is a good value esp since it's AYCE (all you can eat) but I would almost rather just eat at a normal restaurant since I won't eat that much more here. The rolls are a bit above average in terms of quality but lack in creativity and taste compared to regular sushi places in Charlotte I could go to otherwise. Overall, it's a good deal for $20 bucks but if I need my sushi fix, I'm probably more likely to go elsewhere.

BOHsh2Byfq0UqqGzOXdVlw.text: All you can eat sushi???? For $12.99????  Unlimited spring rolls??? Whaaaaaaaaat?  And the sushi was good! Definitely fresh! And the wasabi was amazing. I know that might sound weird but not all places have good wasabi. Anyways, go there.  The service is great too.

t3zXdz-7hSzeEanc1OiuWA.text: I've been to Mr. Tokyo five times over the course of three months. I generally avoid visiting any one restaurant more than once every several months, if at all.  Service: Nothing spectacular, and given the excellent food, not poor enough to justify a rating downgrade.  Food: Excellent. If you're looking for tasty sushi, this is the place. If you're looking for varied and unique sushi flavors, this is the place. If you're looking for incredibly cheap but acceptable quality sushi, this is the place. I highly recommend the Spicy Girl, Mr. Tokyo, and Dragon rolls, as well as the eel, tuna, and squid nigiri. Their beef hibachi is also delicious, with very tender chunks of beef. For just $18.99, you can try most of their specialty rolls (if you have the appetite) in one sitting. You won't regret this place one bit.

P6IIjJgwLIVYO8_9OWyFFg.text: Food here is great- I'm super disappointed with the service here though (we normally go to the one in Matthews). I walked in at 3:20 to get the lunch special with my husband but the lady said it would be a 20 minute wait so I walked back outside to see if we wanted to wait that long because we would miss the lunch special, walked back in five minutes later and another girl seated us right away but said they were switching from lunch special to dinner special and made us pay full price (it wasn't even 3:30 yet!!!) Bait and switch at its finest and extremely unprofessional. Very disappointed.

erF93y8sJ8ux4X80JrWckA.text: So thankful this place is in my neighborhood. It's fast, delicious and has a good lunch deal. The space is not that big so there is a wait on most days but passes quickly as their food comes out a decent time. The sushi is fresh and they make some good speciality rolls.

NM49ExMO6q43M_75QXWKaA.text: Pretty good sushi.  The Carolina roll was on point.  If you are doing all you can eat be prepared for an onslaught of food.  Everything looked great that came out from hibachi to sushi.

2Q5B_hCXxPOiRHjByPB2gg.text: So a couple of friends has bragged on how good Mr. Tokyo is so i was a little disappointed when i finally went it was not at all what i expected. To me the food was so so . I did not get a bang for my buck i know its all you can eat $18.99 was what i paid for the items i chose to eat from the list. They provide you with a pencil and paper of things to check you would like to try but be careful if you get too much you have to pay for what you don't eat on your plate but the good thing of it all is the money goes towards a good cause. One thing i also noticed is the drink menu , theirs pretty much not much of one they offer saki, and wines that's pretty much it far as an alcoholic beverage goes. Now my sushi was pretty good, everything else to me was a blah nothing too much to brag about.

PvhI0zuKWMmU3Pz7iF7ZVg.text: Honestly the first time I went was better than this second visit. This visit made me feel as though I was at a cheap buffet and with the current price they have for all you can eat sushi I would rather eat at nice sushi restaurant because i don't even eat enough to make the all you can eat worth it. The price isnt horrible for all you can eat and the sushi is above average but not amazing. However I was unimpressed by the service and restaurant itself.  Firstly, my waitress didn't bring out the appetizers before the sushi rolls. And then she forgot two of my orders as well and I had to remind her what we ordered. No apology was given after her mistake either.   Secondly, beware of what they give you. If they think you don't know what you're ordering they will cheat you and stuff your rolls with crabmeat or skip out on the fish you ordered. I knew that two of my rolls had a combo of two different raw fish in them and when I brought it up to the waitress she just brushed it over and said oh must have been a mistake in the kitchen. (Again, no apology) This is also is unlikely because how do you forget the main ingredients for two rolls. So I'm guessing they were trying to save money or something. Either way totally unprofessional.  Thirdly, I'm a server myself so I understand getting hungry on a shift. However, sitting down at a table across from us and eating a full meal while on the job is unprofessional.  I believe this restaurant had the potential to be a huge hit but there are two main things that make me want to go back to a restaurant: excellent service and good quality. Both of which was lacking.

fbjDklV7V1TI-GUWK9cOcA.text: Great all you can eat sushi! Kid friendly and lots of parking spots. Friendly staff and clean atmosphere. Just a great sushi spot in Charlotte.

ve7yjm-y-Vuc1aoTm0mOgQ.text: Mr Tokyo's food was delicious. The lunch buffet Mon-Fri is on $12.99 for adults. You fill out your menu as to what you want and the prepare the food fresh and bring it to you to enjoy. So good I will definitely be going back there.

CFZR5EFE-DLcy8LU92o4uA.text: I went to this location with my daughter and it was quite a disappointment. We went to the restaurant and were seated at a table right away.  The waitress came over to take our initial order as this is an all you can eat buffet.  While I was placing my order I advised her that I was allergic to shellfish.  The waitress was quite confused and said that she would check with her manager.  When she returned she said that the restaurant could not accommodate me. She said "the manager suggests you eat somewhere else."  I was highly offended and very disappointed as I left and they added insult to injury when they took my $5 for the two sodas that we ordered.    In 2019 for any food establishment NOT to be able to serve menu items to it's patrons safely is simply UNACCEPTABLE.  If you sell Salmon and I come in and say I want an order of Salmon there is simply no reason why my salmon should get cross contaminated with anything else.  There should be an area where someone who wants fish can still safely get their food prepared.  Thank you for the honesty Mr Tokyo but you really need to fix the situation and do better.  People should not just have to "go somewhere else."  If you have any allergy (shellfish, gluten, peanut, etc.) DO NOT GO HERE. . . all food is prepared in the same small space and using the same knives, grills and mats so you may get sick or could die if the reaction is serious enough.

DYjCN_xgae9XpdJI4K-5tQ.text: Outstanding lunch.  11.99 for AYCE and it's full menu..  really good rolls, friendly staff, and enough avacado to suit my beloved.  All in all, i'd give 6 stars.  We did, however, walk out and leave our Minion toy in the restaurant, so if anyone has found it, please respond.  I have a picture of it with our plate

Photo of Mr Tokyo Japanese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. 5 specialty rolls from the lunch menu

f4RLUqYcoGYls8BGhQh_UQ.text: Hello, So my boyfriend and I came to eat here Wednesday night (02.21.18) and the food was great along with our server. It wasn't until after we began eating unfortunately when both my boyfriend and I were completely discussed at what we witnessed by a young lady (in a white blouse) standing at the computer system right next to the sushi bar (about 3 feet from the actually food and sushi was being made at the time!!!!)  She was FLOSSING HER TEETH!!! Popping her floss from her teeth right towards the food, now I'm in the dental industry and not only is you mouth full of bacteria but what you pull from teeth with floss has an absolutely horrible smell no matter who you are or how well you take care of your teeth! Not only was she flossing right next to the food but she NEVER washed her hands as she continued to work and touch things all around the restaurant!  Needless to say we got our check and got the hell out there, both unsatisfied with what we had just witnessed but also still hungry, we proceeded to come home and order pizza! So sad because ya'll have a great concept but we will NEVER be back, it has to be one of the grosses things I have ever seen take place in a restaurant and I worked F&B for over 10 years! SMH get it under control Mr. Tokyo!!

cy4FKtqGLlqj7KwmQyba2g.text: The best sushi I've ever had in my life survive was really fast and everything was really fresh

exYeAYBELNbbCXQAlP0Rtw.text: This is my third time here. They are great for lunch. The food is served quickly and the portions are spot on.  My wife and son both complained that they didn't use sushi rice or even rice vinegar. But for me it was okay.  The only complaint I have is they don't have any Asian waitresses.

aMo-7TIWR27J4jn6dMC95Q.text: My first experience of Mr. Tokyo was five star for sure. I went on a Friday night with my boyfriend arriving around 8 o'clock. There was a 50 minute wait and we ended up sitting at the sushi bar sooner than 50 minutes. We had: 2 octopus nigirl 3 eel nigirl Rainbow roll Snow white roll Deep blue roll Pepper tuna roll Spicy girl roll Sweet heat roll And last but not least hibachi beef I can't believe we ate the whole thing !!! But we did.....and at $19/person this was a crazy great value. Our favorite was the eel nigiri and the pepper tuna roll. Least favorite was the octopus nigiri. It wasn't bad, just not our favorite. Once we sat down and ordered our sushi it arrived very quickly. Honestly I liked everything about this experience. Can't wait to go back. The value was amazing. I have paid a lot more for lesser quality tasting sushi. Five stars from me.

EcGyLJEEWtncmcPizobekA.text: Came here on a busy Saturday night with my family and the service was great! This place probably has one of the most efficient and attentive service I've experience so far around the area.  Someone is always coming back to check and take orders since this is an ALL YOU CAN EAT JAPANESE RESTAURANT and the best thing about it is that it's COOK TO ORDER. It's $16.99 per person during dinner time but it's so worth the price cause I'm use to paying around $30-40 per person for decent sushi at regular Japanese restaurants.  Mr. Tokyo offers sushi, sashimi, sushi rolls, hibachi entrees, soup and salads, and sushi appetizers. You name it, they probably have it.   We love love LOVE the Mr. Tokyo Roll, it's so good we had to keep ordering it. Oh, and the yellowtail jalapeno is a must try also.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Tokyo Japanese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Mr Tokyo Japanese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

CR0EnCpVaOnw3a6fpdZnZQ.text: Mr. Tokyo serves all-you-can-eat sushi for lunch and dinner with hibachi and a few appetizers on the menu as well. Do yourself a favor and go for an early lunch or a late one. Never go around noon, unless you enjoy waiting 30+ minutes.  FOOD There's not much to say here. There is an abundance of sushi choices on the menu, and I would rate the quality being just a hair over what you might get at a grocery store. I enjoyed it. Pro tip: they have ice cream that is included in your all-you-can-eat price. Don't forget it!  SERVICE Service is decent. The issue is that Mr. Tokyo never has more than two or three guys making sushi, which of course slows everything down. Just make sure to order two or three rolls at once and you should be good.  PRICES $12 for lunch, $18 for dinner. I would say those are fair. If you eat three rolls, the all-you-can-eat prices have paid for themselves.  If you're coming here for world class sushi, you'll be disappointing, but if you just want some decent sushi for fair prices, this is your place. I love it.

2iivDJLYtaVPaH65rTHXhQ.text: This place was phenomenal when it opened but I went there with my fiance last month and overall the place has slipped a bit.  The quality of the sushi has dipped since opening month, which is understandable I suppose. I will say that their eel is not very good at all; even opening month I tried their eel roll and it was probably the worst I've had in Charlotte.  Their specialty rolls are pretty good, anything fried is a good choice, and their crazy roll was great. Not nearly as good as opening month but it's all-you-can-eat sushi so I suppose there's a tradeoff in quality.  I'll say it again the crazy roll is fantastic.  The real deal breaker for me is not the food quality.   Last time I visited was probably the first time in quite a while and they did something I'd never noticed before. Probably around round 3 of sushi the rolls started getting bigger and stuffed with noticeably more rice and fillers (celery etc) than they had in previous rounds. This continued until we stopped ordering. This is a deal breaker for me and trumps anything else since the premise of the restaurant is all-you-can-eat and since they charge you if you don't finish your plate which is clearly marked on the menu. I won't be returning to Mr. Tokyo for this reason, and the decline in quality since the restaurant opened.

cYz0-vyc_SOH62S4WieofA.text: Went for dinner this time.  Much less crowded,  less rushed, and expanded menu.  Better and different experience than at lunch.  The sushi apps (yellowtail and tokyo bowl) are my faves and were not an option at lunch.  Great variety of rolls.  Veggie tempura is great.  Wish you could get half rolls to try more variety.   Come with a group and you'll be golden for variety.

The sushi was great so I see why this place is so popular. This was the first time my friend and I've eaten here and she was highly impressed too. The sushi pieces are huge and tasted amazing. Will be recommending all my friends here and will be coming back! So glad they have another location as well. Good job, Mr. Tokyo!

mbY3Eva5NQltbV6aM7xCPQ.text: Took my 2 littlest kids and wife for 1st time on Sunday evening. Very pleased! My thoughts: FOOD - Excellent. So good, good sizes, well-made. Sushi excellent - as good as Sushi 101 with some cool choices. Everything we ate was just darn good. Would have loved to have a drink but they don't sell alcohol - which is fine and likely reason cost is so low. PRICE - Excellent. For the food and everything, it is incredible. Really. SERVICE - Good. People very friendly and nice. Tried to be helpful but servers forgot some of our order 2x and actually never came back with one of them after being told. Nothing rude - just not great service. Wait for food was, at times, pretty darn long...especially when you have 2 kids under 7 years old. AMBIANCE - Pretty good. Very nice interior, clean, open, not too loud. Seating was bit crowded but nothing bad. Bathroom was pretty nice but it was a bit "dirty" (overfilled trash baskets and stuff on floor). No biggie with a big rush but not great.  Can't wait to go back. Really enjoyed it. Thanks!

uXGB86oozpJCaiukEjMkLQ.text: I hate that I have to write this review because the food was excellent, my husband and I enjoyed everything we ate. And for a great price. However, the service we received was absolutely terrible. Our waitress came over two times in the entire hour and a half we were there, and the last half was spent waiting for our waitress to bring us our check. We finished our sushi, and wanted to order a fried ice cream for dessert, and a glass of white wine. As the time went by, we asked another waitress for another menu to order from. No one ever brought another menu over. Eventually, 30 minutes after finishing our food, we just asked another waitress to get our check for us, as our waitress was in the corner talking and laughing with her friends. We paid, and left without having received everything we wanted to get. I give four stars because the food was amazing, just don't expect good service.

Yha0_bbu-sxsrQJS7R7V4g.text: Second time at Mr Tokyo. Biggest findings: try their Mr Tokyo Bowl and Yellowtail Jalapeno. The essentially are sashimi, and are included in the AYCE price. The catch is they both are 1 order per person. Still happy.

1aVEF2rORSKB3kSp4M5XUg.text: So bummed...was actually looking to treat my parents to a Japanese style dinner. We greeted the hostess and she added our party of three to the waiting list. First of all she added my name wrong. After waiting for an hour and asking how much longer they said it would be another 30min. On top of that the hostess was a bit rude as we tried to figure out why we were getting placed further behind. It seems they made a mistake and as they were busy we weren't as important since someone had made a mistake and not apologized for it. We left promptly after canceling and left. Being from LA, it was probably the best decision since we didn't feel welcomed to the establishment and the since the service lacked class, assumed the food would follow suit. :(

kHZNfqkcMtwnhqc09pW9fw.text: This is absolutely the best Sushi we've had here in the Charlotte area.  I know the name sounds a bit cheesy, but if you are a True lover of Sushi this is where you want to go.  The Sushi is fresh and well prepared.  It is not at all like buffet Sushi.  One of my favorites is the Salmon and Lemon...very refreshing.  I don't care for crispy, crunchy or saucy Sushi. They do have choices for those who don't want Sashimi or Nigiri style.  My kids are always looking for a special occasion to go here.  Almost forgot to mention they've got several types of Saki available as well.

gRrMk9JIY_O4SHltCAcUmA.text: Fantastic sushi, amazing service, super fresh. Once they get their beer license, this will be a True 5-star experience.   Try the yellowtail with jalapeno!

fjhg0nm40BtUYD7cy1unPQ.text: The fish tasted very fresh.  A little more than the ideal amount of sushi rice with the nigiri.  At just $10.99 for AYCE lunch, it's amazing value.  (Consider that at most sushi restaurants, that wouldn't even buy you two rolls.)  Age tofu is 3 pieces per order; gyoza is 6 pieces per order.  There's also soups and salads.  Nigiri is 1 piece per order; rolls are 8 pieces per order.  I was pleased to see the selection of specialty rolls, which to me are more interesting than nigiri.  There's a wide variety even off the lunch menu, with some rolls featuring shrimp tempura or avocado or cream cheese or multiple kinds of tobiko (roe).  They are artfully crafted by the sushi chefs at the bar.  Friendly service, but order turnaround is slow when it's busy.  Makes sense since there's only three sushi chefs.  As a result, it's a little time-consuming to do multiple rounds, unless you order the next round before you empty the current plate.  If they can keep the AYCE price this low, I would definitely come back.  Food:  4 stars Value:  5 stars Service:  3.5 stars Overall:  4.5 stars

WD2zKYpZxHwdh4cd5MM8AA.text: Love the buffet and sushi but don't like how they won't let you take home your left overs!   Other than that, this place is the bomb!

eFJ9ZcWHW9NPDEw5-WxKTw.text: Wait is crazy! It is worth the wait if you have the time! Service can be hit or miss. Couldn't get our server back to the table. Had to ask for others to find her!   Updated my review to show a 5 star! It is a great feeling with when a business takes the time to reply to even a 4 star review! I greatly appreciate recognizing my post!

3ulvjnlZSi5dCmPuud1sWw.text: Came here for dinner. It's a small place, and with people ordering non-stop, it's no wonder our wait time was 1 hour for TWO people. For the price of $19.99 (basically $20, let's be honest), you can order as many menu items as you desire, with the exception of sashimi (extra $0.50 per piece) and desserts (extra charge). Also, any leftovers will be an additional charge as well, so make sure that you only order what you can finish. There is no limit as to how many orders you can request at one time. However, it took a good while for our sushi to arrive, so order a bunch of appetizers to satisfy your hunger in the meantime.  Miso Soup - Tasty but would have loved some tofu in it. Avocado Salad - Literally a bowl of avocado slices on top of lettuce. Aged Tofu - 3 pieces - Crispy on the outside, soft and hot on the inside. Crab Rangoon - 2 pieces - These are folded envelope style. The skin is nice and crispy, and there is a good amount of filling. Wish the sweet and spicy dipped sauce was provided in a bigger container for better dipping though. Edamame - Salted on the outside, nothing to complain about. Gyoza - 3 pieces - The skin is done well. Spring Roll - 2 pieces - Perfectly crispy skin, but not so impressive filling Mostly cabbage in the filling. Shumai - 2 pieces - The pieces are incredibly small, bite-sized. They remind me of the frozen shumai, nothing special. Shrimp Tempura - 3 pieces - Perfectly flaky, but again, I wish the dipping sauce was contained in a bigger dish, especially considering how long the shrimp are. Salmon Lover - salmon, cucumber, avocado with slices of salmon on top, 8 pieces Snow White Roll - sweet crabmeat, avocado with salmon, tuna, escolar, and crunchy shavings on top, 8 pieces Deep Blue Roll - tempura crabmeat, mango, avocado with lobster chunks on top, 8 pieces  I enjoyed the Snow White Roll the most, and then the Deep Blue Roll, and then the Salmon Lover. The fish is fresh and delicious. The sushi come out all at one time, beautifully displayed on a platter. I hate that the sashimi is charged extra per piece. However, there are plenty of other items on the menu to select.

SAHXJVHAot19EcZITDTldQ.text: Rude Manager/Overpriced/Forced gratuity for family of 5 We ate at the Pineville store after some recommendations from others. We had a party of 5 (family). 3 chose the all you could eat and 2 ate off the ala carte menu. The ala carte menu was $6 cheaper but had 3 times more food than the all you can eat portion for the same items. We waited over 45 min to get our food the first time and reordered immediately when we saw the portion on the all you can eat. We waited another 45 min to receive the second plate, after everyone else was finished eating. Even with the first and second plates combined, there was still less food on the all you could eat compared to the amount of food given on the ala carte plate. We had a family of 5. We were charged an 18% gratuity. We had not complained or even asked why our food was taking so long. We were there not quite 2 hours. Luckily we didn't have little ones.  I asked the manager to take it off the automatic gratuity so I could tip the server in cash (and more than 18% and the manager was rude and refused). Since the law now gives automatic gratuity to the store, it is very possible the server will not receive any of the gratuity I was forced to pay. There were only 5 of us...not a group of random people but a family and I was paying the entire bill (not split in anyway). This incident will keep us from ever going back. My 22 year old felt her chicken was slimy and didn't like the taste of her hibachi chicken. There was not an option for plain rice...you had to have fried rice. Miso soup came with the meal but clear soup was an extra charge. The all you can eat was definitely not worth the money when you have to wait that long for a simple teriyaki chicken and plain fried rice dish. It took so long, we didn't want to wait for another order, and I would question if this was intentional. Mind you, the restaurant was not packed (not empty either) and there were plenty of open tables. We had to sit one person at the end of a booth in a chair in a main walkway - but there were plenty of other open tables. There were plenty of servers. Ours was sweet but she couldn't bring food that wasn't ready. It appeared she had 2 tables (including ours). This is why I was planning on tipping her more than 18%. I prefer to tip In cash so servers can take home the cash the same day they make it. But the manager refused to take it off, even with me showing her the cash and telling her I was planning on tipping her well.  One of our all you could eat diners, ordered 2 sushi rolls (only) and was charged $2 more for each one because they were on the list for all you could eat. Deserts were also an additional cost from the all you could eat. Ala carte was definitely the better way to go. However, less than a mile away is a major Japanese restaurant that you can eat to the side and the cost is much less or even costs less to watch the "the show" with much better quality food. Regardless, I will not return ever to this restaurant. Managers should do what they can to help their servers. I question how many times parties of 4 or more are being charged a service fee and the tip Is not making it to the actual server. Show less Date of visit: July 2019

als5Cl69i4gw3A6RBZp1DQ.text: Been to this one four times and the one in Huntersville eight times.   We've given favorable reviews before and to our friends as well.  Always impressed by the service and food, however that was shredded tonight!  Looked to see what time they close - 10:30PM.  Tonight my wife and I stopped in after a movie and arrived at 9:35PM and was told rudely it was too close to 10:30PM for a table.  Unreal.  Very disappointed.  I understand if we'd walked in at 10PM or after - but close to an hour before closing??!!  REALLY.    Needless to say we will not be back here or any Mr. Tokyo from now on.  You lost a customer.  Why not change your hours to reflect this and also TURN OFF YOUR SIGN OUT FRONT - OPEN means you sit people.

WJzhXrN1E2Naebi07nas9g.text: I really loved everything about Mr. Tokoyo's except the waiting area is so small considering it's always a line. I wasn't expecting full size sushi with the all you can eat but to my surprise they were ! I was blown away with the hibachi . My meat was seasoned so well which exceeded my expectations. Most hibachi places the meat is usually bland. I'm never going anywhere else for hibachi. The lunch deal is pretty solid at 12.99 for all you can eat . I ordered spring rolls, a salad, a roll and chicken and shrimp hibachi. That could have easily been $20 somewhere else. It's definitely worth it but be careful, you will get charged for what you don't eat . My friend was charged about $2 for each sushi piece she didn't consume.

JwnH6w89Kt1zRdkvlqkL1w.text: Some of the best sushi rolls in Charlotte! A lot of sushi places give you smaller rolls, but these were larger and filling. My friend and I ordered the all you can eat for 20, which was a great deal! You could choose from appetizers, specialty rolls, hibachi and more. We loved every single roll that we had. I will be back!

They messed up my order and I said I didnt want it. I took one bite like the chicken was undercooked. Anyways... the lady said "all y'all want freee food" and said " black  people always do this" then she made other racist comments insinuating it was our race that made us not want the hibachi AND not the undercooked food. 2CTEJI-jC_gB5j3cDO0Mew.text: Wow. All you can eat sushi/Japanese buffet anytime of day, just different prices at different times, as well as, minor changes to the menu. It's a very popular restaurant so be prepared for some kind of wait time. Some times you might even get into shared table seating which isn't so bad, it'll be a social event - depending on your mood (lol). Once you're seated each person gets a paper menu and you can put the quantity of each dish that you want. It is all you can eat, so you can get as many papers as you want. To make it easier, we put both of our orders onto one paper so that our rolls come out on one dish instead of two plates. Be careful some items are one order per person because of limited amount (like the yellowtail jalapeno or the Mr. Tokyo bowl). Other items might be a slight extra charge (sashimi was 0.50 cents per piece).   Overall ALL the sushi rolls were great and fresh. My favorites were the Tiger Roll and the Charlotte Roll. My favorite appetizer is the clear soup. There's also edamame, mid soup, crab Rangoon, seaweed salad, classic rolls. I was surprised that they had a spicy California roll, by the time I saw that I was already full and couldn't dare try it. We also had the hibachi with shrimp and veggies only. You can have it with steak, chicken, or rice, or all of the above - you can circle what you'd like.

X-EN95RSKxjh6mCSwbGk1w.text: I lost my appetite from waiting for their extremely slow service. I watched someone eat seated after me and get twice the amount of sushi I ordered before me. I've fined for dinner before and had better service, however this experience overshadowed the previous visit. Not to mention the sliver of eel on the dragon roll which was all rice and the tiniest sliver of eel I've ever seen on a sushi roll in my ENTIRE LIFE. Just don't offer eel if you don't want to serve it. Not put it on the menu and barely give people what they're paying for. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE service. Very disappointing.

qvRJfw2MCVnjbRW34dNRGw.text: Pineville....the 7-11 of sushi all rice no fish. On the all you can eat menu.   Save your $20 don't buy trash go to a real restaurant.

gATfTnl4_VLXuRUqMcKezg.text: Tucked away in a strip mall In Pineville, this location and concept offers a great opportunity to try and taste (made to order) sushi.  They are open for lunch and dinner.  The location is not fancy or large but it gets the job done.   So basically, its an all you can eat that's brought to your table for a flat fee of $18.99/adult dinner prices.    I really like that they charge you for pieces left over, as a result it causes one to be cognizant of what you order, not ordering too much/only ordering what you will eat.  Our last visit was at 7pm on a Sunday night.  They were busy and we had to wait for about 25 minutes, buuuut it was SOOOO worth it! If you're not seated in one of the booths, you may have to share a table with the other patrons.  I welcome this as its a good chance to see other types of sushi that I may not be aware of.   They also offer appetizers, such as 2 triangle shaped crab rangoons (soo delish!), veggie tempura, awesome shrimp tempura.  Be sure to try the Mr. Tokyo Bowl (limit one per person!)   They also offer hibachi, fried rice etc.   There are some items that aren't included under the $18.99, such as ice cream and desserts such as fried cheesecake. The fried cheesecake is super rich and perhaps a little weird bec of the texture.  Regardless, great place to catch up with friends and family with a bonus of good sushi. This place has quickly become one of our favorite places for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Tokyo Japanese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yellowtail Jalepeno

Photo of Mr Tokyo Japanese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garden Roll

kfHYbCAmtP4DZBZkfAgpRw.text: I've come back again and have enjoyed my visit once again!! The food here seriously never disappoints. This time I went during the weekday for lunch (12.99) and their menu is very different from the dinner/weekend menu where for $20 you get a lot more options. On the lunch menu you miss out on the Salmon Lover Roll, Mr Tokyo Bowl and many more types of Nigiri including my personal favorite Eel Nigiri. Don't get me wrong, for 12.99 the options are still amazing and the quality of the sushi is also good but for $20 you get a more whole experience. We ordered the salmon nigiri, dragon roll, and another roll with crab and mango in it (forgot the name), along with the KFC roll. All the rolls are fantastic as usual but the KFC roll is something different. Very unique chicken sushi with a hint of spice. I would try it if you still for room in your stomach and like fried chicken. It has a very unique taste. I think next time I would still come for lunch (even with a smaller menu) if I'm craving sushi... but if you want to FEAST, I would I invest $7 more dollars for the $20 dinner/weekend menu.

bJ3g-LfmpRrc2vx2C9B98w.text: Service is horrible especially if you are getting the unlimited you shouldn't have to wait 20-30 minutes for the next plate. If you're coming plan to spend hours here The chicken I received tasted extremely rubbery. You can go to many more Japanese places in the area for cheaper + better food.

NyIxIXQb2kgNjSJYddKnjw.text: Maybe I caught them on a bad day.  Rolled up and saw about 10 - 15 people waiting outside and I got excited.  I figured this many people waiting, it must be good.  It was OK.  Just OK.    I saddled up to the bar and didn't have to wait which was good.  Those guys rolling sushi were straight up hustling.  There was like 4 of them and they didn't stop.  Service was lacking.  The servers that I dealt with didn't talk much and didn't speak or seem to understand much English.  With this type of place with the all you can eat, and the rules on the menu it'd be nice if the servers could answer questions.  This all could be forgiven for amazing sushi.  It was good, nothing to write home about and frankly the bar is set low in the Queen City for amazing sushi imo.  Rolls were good, but uninspiring.  The fish was fresh and tasty which was a good thing.  The value for what you get is good also.  For $12.95 I got an order of gyoza, and 2 rolls.  I could have squeaked out another roll and really gotten my money's worth but didn't want to be miserable the rest of the day.  All this to say.  I doubt I'll be back.....if you're looking for quantity and above the normal quality in this area.....Mr Tokyo fits the bill

K7w8OYytxpt2RAF-7dVZyA.text: Awful.  Starting with the service, the waitstaff all were disinterested in being at work and were all congregated to the right of the sushi bar up front, talking, looking at their cell phones, not paying attention to diners.  The server we had didn't welcome us, just stood by the table and didn't offer assistance or converse while we were looking at the menu.  The "sushi" was the worst quality of "fish" that I ever had.  DO NOT ORDER SASHIMI TUNA.  It was so poor and I'm not sure it was even legit.  The hibachi steak was the worst cut pieces of meat I've had, tough, grisly and looked unappetizing.  Disgusting really.  Don't waste your $$ buying the all you can eat concept.  It's a joke and marketing ploy.  WAY OVERPRICED FOR THE LACK OF SERVICE AND QUALITY OF FOOD.  Spend your money elsewhere.  Anywhere but here. I'm warning you!

oIgj_QmRQlrHA8-_zvwmzg.text: The food was really good, but the problem is when we eat, they just keep watching us and make us really uncomfortable even know I'm not hiding anything. The place close at 9:30 but they ask us to go at 9:00 and we not even finish the food. They charge us extra money because they think my baby was 3 years even I have tell them that he was 2 years old. If the restaurant see this please improve!

IdBDJdwpLG4BozrTSYWApQ.text: I'm really disappointed, I've always like this place but today something was different. As someone who has lived with high metabolism, I can feel in the restaurant if something is not fresh and there is definitely a sanitation issue.  1. The whole time there was water dripping from the ceiling right next to my table. 2. The food literally made me feel sick to my stomach.  3. I don't mind paying for the excess but it was literally making me feel sick, and inexcusable. Usually I have no problem eating that amount of sushi but between diarrhea and paying extra, I prefer my well-being. The manager was also pretty rude when addressing this issue I had. She insisted that her "health insurance" can pay if I get a health complication. And no matter my experience she has to follow "policy". Not a way a good manager would've handled things.  I don't think I will be returning.

4NKfAIM9VazfazZFon7_Gw.text: Well, somehow I have not written a review yet, which is odd because this is my favorite restaurant. I frequent both locations and have spent 2 birthdays here. I live in the middle of both locations, so it's really a matter of which one am I closer to at the time or what time/day of the week it is.  I have never ordered anything off of the regular menu as I always get the all you can eat special for $18.99. But, let me say this, it is well worth it! You pay the one price and you get unlimited food. You have an order sheet and you fill out what you want, then they go back and make it fresh. I am at the point where I get the same thing each time.   On my first order, I always get an order of Shrimp Tempura, Crab Rangoon, Angel Hair Roll (Tempura Shrimp, Cucumber, Crab meat and mas ago on top), and a Spiderman Roll (Tempura Soft Shell Crab, Tempura Shrimp, Avocado, and Lettuce). My favorite being the Angel Hair Roll. It has a little kick to it, but I love it!  On my second order, I normally switch over to Steak HIbachi. Then, if I have any space left, I order more sushi or just get another order of Crab Rangoon. Honestly, I don't think anyone that loves Japanese food will have a problem finding something to eat here. I remember when I didn't like sushi that much and now I can't get enough of it.   Just go, you won't be disappointed at all!
